p: Apart from that, genistein plays an important role in regulating the glucose level in blood as well as induces insulinotropic action viz. stimulating or affecting the production and activity of insulin (an insulinotropic hormone). In fact, genistein exhibited significant glucose consumption-augmenting effects in IR-HepG2 cells [ 72]. This study was also in line with Chen et al. [ 90], who mentioned that genistein modified basal glucose uptake in HepG2 cells. In addition, Kwon et al. [ 57] demonstrated that genistein generated an in vitro insulinotropic action by stimulating glucagon-like peptide-1 secretion in enteroendocrine NCI-H716 cells.
